thread.title: Motorists watch out: New parking tickets in UAE take effect
thread.title_full: Motorists watch out: New parking tickets in UAE take effect

title: Motorists watch out: New parking tickets in UAE take effect

organizations.name: department of municipal affairs and transport

text: Motorists watch out: New parking tickets in UAE take effect Wam /Abu Dhabi Filed on February 11, 2017 Share Vote The fine for illegal parking in residential areas is reduced from Dh500 to Dh200. The Department of Municipal Affairs and Transport's (DMAT) Integrated Transport Center announced the new modified parking violations regulations in Abu Dhabi as part of its plans to offer the best services and improve the Parking Division (Mawaqif) as the tickets costs are discounted. Mohammed Hamad Al Muhairi, Mawaqif Director stated that illegal parking in residential areas tickets is reduced from Dh500 to Dh200. In addition, cars will only be towed 4 hours after issuing the ticket. On the other hand, illegal parking in buses and taxi parking bays became Dh500 after it was Dh1000. Occupying two parking spaces is reduced from Dh300 to Dh200. Moreover, using a ticket or permit not specified for parking area is Dh100 after it was Dh200. Al Muhairi stated that there are two new parking violations; one is for using fake permits or tickets. This ticket costs Dh10,000. The other violation ticket is Dh1000 for those who avoid payment of their previous tickets. It is worth mentioning that some parking violations ticket remained the same like the illegal parking in front of a Fire Inlet or parking in a space designated for special needs without an appropriate permit, hindering the traffic and cars are to be towed if were parked in spaces for more than three days repeatedly. Mawaqif requests the drivers to be complied with the rules of parking issued by Mawaqif in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi and to avoid violations. Share
